These waves hit your eardrums, and your brain interprets them as sound. Big vibrations or strong pressure waves make louder sounds. For example, thunder is loud because it‚Äôs a huge release of energy from lightning, and an explosion is loud because it creates a sudden, powerful burst of pressure.
